title: Publikationen
text:
Publikationen
-
Reinhardt, D., Baur, C., Klüber, S., & Hurtienne, J. (2020). MindPeaks: Formative Evaluation Method of Mindfulness Meditation Apps. Paper presented at the Companion Publication of the 2020 ACM Designing Interactive Systems Conference, Eindhoven, Netherlands.
[https://doi.org/10.1145/3393914.3395855](https://doi.org/10.1145/3393914.3395855)
-
Reinhardt, D., Hurtienne, J., & Wienrich, C. (2020). Measuring Mental Effort via Entropy in VR. In Proceedings of the 25th International Conference on Intelligent User Interfaces Companion (p. 43-44). ACM, New York, NY, USA.
-
Reinhardt, D., & Hurtienne, J. (2019). Only one item left?: Heuristic Information Trumps Calorie Count When Supporting Healthy Snacking Under Low Self-Control. In Proceedings of the 2019 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems(p. 478). ACM.
-
Reinhardt, D., Haesler, S., Hurtienne, J., & Wienrich, C. (2019). Entropy of Controller Movements Reflects Mental Workload in Virtual Reality. In Proceedings of the 26th IEEE Conference on Virtual Reality and 3D User Interfaces. IEEE.
-
Grundgeiger, T., Huber, S., Reinhardt, D., Steinisch, A., Happel, O., & Wurmb, T. (2019). Cognitive Aids in Acute Care: Investigating How Cognitive Aids Affect and Support In-hospital Emergency Teams. In Proceedings of the 2019 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems (p. 654). ACM [Won honorable mention award].
- Burmester, M., Haasler, K., Schippert, K., Engel, V., Tille, R., Reinhardt, D., & Hurtienne, J. (2018). Lost in Space? 3D-Interaction-Patterns für einfache und positive Nutzung von 3D Interfaces. Mensch und Computer 2018-Usability Professionals.
- Reinhardt, D., Kuge, J., & Hurtienne, J. (2018). CHAI: coding heuristics for assessing intuitive interaction. In International Conference of Design, User Experience, and Usability (pp. 528-545). Springer, Cham.
- Reinhardt, D., & Hurtienne, J. (2018). Cursor Entropy Reveals Decision Fatigue. In Proceedings of the 23rd International Conference on Intelligent User Interfaces Companion (p. 31). New York: ACM.
- Reinhardt, D., & Hurtienne, J. (2018). The Impact of Tangible Props on Gaming Performance and Experience in Gestural Interaction. In Proceedings of the Eleventh International Conference on Tangible, Embedded, and Embodied Interaction. New York: ACM [Won honorable mention award]
- Hurtienne, J., & Reinhardt, D. (2017). Teaching Data Physicalisation to HCI Students – A Case Report. Position Paper for the Workshop: Pedagogy & Physicalization: Designing Learning Activities around Physical Data Representations at Designing Interactive Systems Conference (DIS ’17). Edinburgh, UK: ACM.
- Reinhardt, D., & Hurtienne, J. (2017). Interaction Under Pressure: Increased Mental Workload Makes Issues of Intuitive Interaction Visible. In Proceedings of the 2016 ACM Conference Companion Publication on Designing Interactive Systems (pp. 67-71). ACM.
- Hurtienne, J., & Reinhardt, D. (2017). Texture Metaphors and Tangible Interaction: No Smooth Relationship?. In Proceedings of the Tenth International Conference on Tangible, Embedded, and Embodied Interaction (pp. 79-87). ACM.
- Wurmb, T., Huber, S., Grundgeiger, T., Reinhardt, D., Steinisch, A., & Happel, O. (2017). “Cognitive Aid“ und Echtzeit-Dokumentation bei innerklinischen Reanimationen: Weiterentwicklung einer Tablet-PC basierten „App“. Presentation auf den Wissenschaftlichen Arbeitstagen Notfallmedizin (WATN) 2017, 12.-13.02.17, Kiel.
- Grundgeiger, T., Albert, M., Reinhardt, D., Happel, O., Steinisch, M., & Wurmb, T. (2016). Real-time tablet-based resuscitation documentation by the team lead: Evaluating documentation quality and clinical performance. Scandinavian Journal of Trauma, Resuscitation and Emergency Medicine, 24(1), 1-7.
- Reinhardt, D., Kraft, A-K., Albert, M., Grundgeiger, T., Happel, O., Steinisch, A., &. Wurmb, T. (2015). Development and formative evaluation of the DoRea App for realtime resuscitation documentation. Proceedings of the 59th Annual Meeting of the Human Factors and Ergonomics Society. Los Angeles, CA: October 26–30, 2015. [Won Dieter W. Jahns Student Practitioner Award 2015 of the Foundation for Professional Ergonomics]
